feat: Shall Not Falter, Shall Not Rout
feat_markdown: Shall Not Falter, Shall Not Rout
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Shall Not Falter, Shall Not Rout](/Feats.aspx?ID=2168) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Legends](/Sources.aspx?ID=40) pg. 69</row>

**Archetype** [Knight Reclaimant](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=28)

**Prerequisites**
[Knight Reclaimant Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1097)

</column>

---

You gain the [_shall not falter, shall not rout_](/Spells.aspx?ID=817) focus spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can regain using the [Refocus](/Actions.aspx?ID=71) activity to recite the Crimson Oath and meditate on its teachings. If you already have a focus pool, increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1. Your knight reclaimant focus spells are divine spells; when you gain this feat, you become trained in divine spell attacks and spell DCs and your spellcasting ability is Charisma.

<title level="2">Knights in Training</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Legends](/Sources.aspx?ID=40) pg. 68</row>

The following feats represent benefits of training from the Iomedars (Kalabrynne for knight vigilant, Clarethe for knight reclaimant, either for Lastwall sentry).

**Related Feats**: [Rescuer's Press](/Feats.aspx?ID=2167), [Vigil's Walls Rise Anew!](/Feats.aspx?ID=2169)
